subject: Ski Jumping
lead_paragraph: Thomas Morgenstern of Austria failed to win a record seventh consecutive event in World Cup ski jumping after finishing third in Engelberg, Switzerland.Morgenstern, the Olympic champion, was beaten by Andreas Kuettel of Switzerland, who won with jumps of 411 feet 9 inches and 446-3 in the large hill for 252.7 points.Austria’s Gregor Schlierenzauer was second with 248.9 points after jumps of 408-6 and 446-3.Morgenstern was third with 408-6 and 442-11 for 246.6 points.Going into the meet, he had become the first skier to post five consecutive victories to start a season.Morgenstern leads the World Cup standings with 660 points.
